intro: Byrsella lappifera, commonly known as the lappifera byrsella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a rough texture. Byrsella lappifera is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
